info.game_comments:
Sean Ryan game 1.

(Sarah: The weatherman says there's snow on the way: about 5 clues worth; stay tuned for clues from Squaw Valley on Jeopardy!)

(1, 1).clue: 1973:"People have got to know whether or not their president is" one of these; "well I'm not" one of these

(3, 1).clue: Its national anthem is called "Deutschlandlied" & is based on a melody by Joseph Haydn

(4, 1).clue: Clusius, a botanist, is credited with growing the first tulips in this country back in the 16th century

(5, 1).clue: One knows Easter falls on this date in 2018, so you might have to watch out for rotten eggs left as a joke

(1, 2).clue: 1970:This Asian nation is "A great & vital people who should not remain isolated..."

(3, 2).clue: Claude-Joseph Rouget de Lisle composed it in one night during the French Revolution

(4, 2).clue: Normally, you should buy & plant your tulip bulbs in this season

(5, 2).clue: One knows Percival liked quests, like this Everest climber whose middle name is Percival

(6, 2).clue: In a circle, 2 of these make up a diameter

(1, 3).clue: 1977:"When the president does it, that means that it is not" this

(3, 3).clue: Greenland has the same national anthem ("Der er et Yndigt Land") as this country

(4, 3).clue: This tune featured in the 1929 film "Gold Diggers of Broadway" was famously revived in 1968

(5, 3).clue: One knows in January 2000 1 of the 3 Wilson volleyballs used in this film sold at auction for $18,400

(6, 3).clue: In 79 A.D. it was 1 of the 3 cities burned by Vesuvius

(1, 4).clue: 1969:"It's time for the great" this "of Americans to stand up and be counted"

(3, 4).clue: This country probably isn't neutral about "Schweizer Psalm", its national anthem

(4, 4).clue: His first volume of poetry was "Tulips and Chimneys"; so in 1923 he was still using some upper case letters

(5, 4).clue: One knows sitars are stringed instruments & these are Greek deities that have the legs of a goat

(6, 4).clue: Dark & meaty, it's used in Oriental dishes

(1, 5).clue: 1962:"You won't have Nixon to kick around anymore, because, gentlemen, this is my last" of these

(3, 5).clue: "La Brabanconne" is the national anthem of this Low Country

(4, 5).clue: Characterized by "broken" colors, this late-flowering tulip group has the name of a noted artist

(5, 5).clue: One knows ABC is owned by Disney, CBS by Viacom & NBC by this company

(6, 5).clue: A nene is this type of goose that leis eggs

(1, 1).clue: Kurt Vonnegut called it "Skyscraper National Park"

(2, 1).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew at a ski resort in Squaw Valley, California)  In the international trail marking system, green circle means easy; blue square, tougher & black these, hardest

(3, 1).clue: Maybe you can help those Scotland Yard bozos catch him in 1888; here's a sketch to work with

(4, 1).clue: Office fixture that lent its name to what early Internet users posted their messages on

(5, 1).clue: "Shadow Warriors" from this novelist is a look at our military's special forces

(6, 1).clue: In crosswords a swamp may be a fen or this

(2, 2).clue: In this sport the short track is an oval, 364 feet in circumference

(3, 2).clue: For your trip to the 1980s, I got you this exclusive-sounding brand of jacket from Aris Industries

(4, 2).clue: Listen up: one of the first commercial items to use transistors was one of these listening devices

(5, 2).clue: This Washington Post veteran attempts to give the inside story on "Bush at War"

(6, 2).clue: It's a crowlike bird, often blue

(2, 3).clue: (Sarah)  Phrase for what snowboarders are now known for doing...as well as hoboes

(3, 3).clue: You're going to the battlefields of World War I -- find a safe one of these but avoid the foot problems named for it

(6, 3).clue: It's a section of pineapple skin, an apple seed, a spot on a die or a Dickens character
